An excellent budget laptop from HP at around 27k range. Being 15.6 inches, it
has separate numeric keypad and the keyboard has keys with good spacing in
between. Overall performance is good for average daily usage of MS
office,youtube,netflix mails,light gaming etc. However not recommended for
heavy gaming purposes due to core i3 CPU and 4 GB ram. Installed windows 10
Pro myself and saved about 4k.  
If required for heavy usage then opt for atleast core i5 CPU and 8 GB ram.

Product is giid but body is very week. If HP can make body stronger then i
will give 5 star to it.

Nice machine at this price range.  
Touch and feel of this machine looks premium.  
3 and a half to 4 hours of battery backup is what one can expect during usage.  
Not good for games, Not much better than the Pentium CPUs.

Pros  
Fast and quick performance with everyday use applications  
Good quality vibrant display  
Flawless keyboard and touchpad  
Lightweight and appealing design  
Loud and crisp Audio  
  
Cons  
No dedicated graphics card  
No Windows 10  
  
Performance  
If your everyday PC use involves watching Youtube, movies, browsing the
Internet, working with Microsoft office applications, etc Intel Core i3 6006U
processor included in HP 15q-BU004TU is ample to carry out these tasks. The
stock clock speed of 2GHz offered by 6006U can smoothly handle regular office
and multimedia applications. Moreover, users can indulge in multitasking to a
certain extent. The 4 GB DDR4 (upgradeable up to 8GB) over single slot
included in the laptop is adequate for running multiple casual applications.
The laptop does not come with a dedicated graphics card, it uses the
integrated Intel HD 520 graphics to function games and other graphics-oriented
applications. With optimizing the settings- low details at 720p resolution,
many exciting games such as GTA 5, Call of Duty, Battlefield 4, etc can be
played on this laptop. However, in all rights, this is not a gaming laptop.
The low weight games such as Fifa 17, Counter-Strike, Minecraft, Dota 2 etc
can be played at medium settings with good frame rates.  
  
Display  
The picture quality of the screen is satisfactory. For beginners, the screen
might appear exceptional but if examined closely or compared with other high-
end displays, obviously it lacks in terms of contrast and sharpness. The best
thing about this screen is its brightness. There is no dullness which gives
clear visuals. The color reproduction ability is average. Overall, the 15.6
inch HD (1366 x 768) LED-backlit display on this laptop is decent for a budget
laptop.  
  
Keyboard and Touchpad  
The keyboard on BU004TU is well laid out and exceptionally comfortable for
long hours of typing. The key travel is shallow and bit noisy. Overall, the
cheapness is not suddenly obvious and it is a good keyboard in this price
range. The touchpad, unlike the conventional ones, does not have separate
buttons. It is quite precise and responsive. With the installation of the
latest synaptic driver from the HP site, the trackpad will function great
without any problem.  
  
Ports and connectivity  
This laptop has a good variety of ports like many of the HP laptops in the
range. It is equipped with HDMI port, USB 2.0 port, RJ-45, headphone jack, and
2 USB 3.1 Gen 1 (USB 3.0) ports. HP 15q-BU004TU is able to catch signals
within 50m (164 feet) indoors and 100m (328 feet) outdoors. The Bluetooth 4.0
unlike the older versions discovers devices quickly and is more secure in
sending data.  
  
Audio  
HP 15q bu004tu features dual 2W speakers. HP claims the speakers are suitable
for all types of usage- streaming videos, listening to music, watching movies
and playing games. But this is sort of true. The speakers are definitely loud
and clear but the these do not offer the best experience while playing games
and listening to music. Using headphones in these cases is much more relevant
than hearing through these speakers because the sound emitted by them is
compressed and do not have clear bass. The overall audio is focused on mid and
treble parts. In a laptop at this price range, we can not expect anything
better.  
  
Battery  
The laptop sports a 4-cell, 41 Wh Lithium-ion battery. It has the fast charge
feature which fills the battery quite fast- 2 hours for charging from zero to
full. When it comes to backup, on idle the laptop stays alive for more than 6
hours. On heavy load, the backup diminishes up to 2.5 hours and on casual use
involving browsing, watching movies etc it gives an average backup up to 4.5
hours. The battery clearly outpaces Lenovo laptops in terms of backup in this
price range.
